image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'They were men': Trump falsely labels female Olympic boxers, again
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia launches third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month, Ukraine says
Hamas planned to exhume remains of British and Commonwealth soldiers from World War I and II buried in Gaza: IDF
item.description: Israeli Defence Forces discovered a 2022 plan by Hamas leaders to exhume British and Commonwealth soldiers’ remains from Gaza to prevent the UK from moving its embassy to Jerusalem. The plan included holding the remains hostage or demanding lease fees. Though the embassy move was cancelled, concerns persist that Hamas may use similar tactics in the future.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Still remember how excited she was...': Kamala shares childhood pic with mother
item.description: Kamala Harris revealed via social media that she worked at McDonald's as a teenager and during college to earn spending money. She reflected on her middle-class upbringing and her mother’s hard work to buy a home. Harris pledged to address economic struggles, reduce living costs, and provide mortgage assistance and tax credits for parents if elected President.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Attempt to intimidate': FBI raids US home of analyst Dimitri Simes who advised Trump in 2016
item.description: The FBI conducted a raid on the Virginia home of Dimitri Simes, a former advisor to Donald Trump’s 2016 campaign. Simes, who was out of the country during the raid, expressed confusion and concern. His name appeared multiple times in the Mueller report on Russian interference. Simes has been active in Russia, recently moderating discussions with President Putin.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NYC mayor Eric Adams makes gaffe, confuses India with Pakistan at India Day Parade
item.description: Mayor Eric Adams of New York City made a significant error during his speech at an Indian Independence Day celebration in Queens. He mistakenly referred to India and its diaspora community as 'Pakistan' multiple times. Despite multiple reminders of the corrected name from the crowd, Adams continued to confuse the two nations in his remarks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'They turned him down because he’s Jewish': Trump on Josh Shapiro
item.description: Former President Donald Trump claimed at a rally in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania that Jews in the US face the most dangerous situation since the Holocaust. He cited a spike in antisemitic incidents and criticized Vice President Kamala Harris for allegedly not choosing Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro as her running mate due to his Jewish faith, a claim Shapiro denied.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Saw Netflix series about their life ...': Columbia's vice president reveals real reason behind inviting Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to Colombia was prompted by an invitation from Vice President Francia Márquez, who was inspired by their Netflix docuseries. The purpose of their visit was to promote mental health for young people and combat cyberbullying. Their series sheds light on their decision to step back from royal roles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump criticises Harris’ newly announced ‘Kamalanomics’
item.description: Former President Donald Trump, during a rally in Pennsylvania, criticised Vice President Kamala Harris's new economic plan, calling it 'full communist.' Trump argued that Harris's proposals for price controls on food and groceries would lead to negative outcomes like rationing and inflation, comparing them to failed policies in Venezuela and the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK government, for first time, plans to treat extreme misogyny as terrorism
item.description: The UK government introduced a new approach to counter-terrorism by addressing extreme misogyny. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper ordered a review to fill gaps in the current legislation and involve teachers, healthcare professionals, and local authorities in Prevent referrals. The initiative aims to combat the radicalisation of young men influenced by misogynistic figures. The new strategy is expected next year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Things I trust more than Trump’: Ana Navarro's list goes viral
item.description: Ana Navarro's Instagram post titled 'Things I Trust More Than Trump' went viral, featuring a humorous list of ten items. The list, including 'Flint, Michigan tap water' and 'gas station sushi,' sparked widespread engagement with over 50,000 likes. Followers and Navarro herself added more items to the list, driving further engagement and attention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nine Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf-affiliated MPs demand recusal of chief justice in election tribunals case
item.description: Nine PTI candidates demanded the recusal of CJP Qazi Faez Isa from hearing the case on Election Tribunals in Punjab. They claimed their lawyers faced difficulties in filing the application. The Supreme Court had suspended an earlier High Court judgement regarding tribunal formations. The case hearing is scheduled for August 19 with requests for adjournment due to lawyer availability issues.

item.title: Russia opens criminal probe into Italian journalists who entered Kursk
Germany to cut Ukraine military aid in 2025
South Korea, Japan, US leaders renew pledge to cooperate on regional challenges
item.description: The leaders of South Korea, Japan, and the United States reaffirmed their commitment to address regional challenges in a joint statement on the anniversary of their Camp David summit. They emphasized continued military and economic cooperation to counter threats from China and North Korea.

item.title: Yunus to brief foreign diplomats in Dhaka today
Israeli airstrike kills 15 in Gaza; mediators hope for a ceasefire
Strengthening positions in western Russia, says Ukraine
‘We are not alone’: Ex-defense official claims in new UFO memoir
item.description: Former senior defense official Luis Elizondo, in his memoir 'Imminent: Inside the Pentagon's Hunt for UFOs,' revealed that glowing green orbs invaded his home, affecting his personal life. These events, witnessed by his family and neighbors, highlighted ongoing government knowledge of UFOs since the 1940s. Elizondo emphasized the need for public awareness and official disclosure on these phenomena.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No joke: The onion thinks print is the future of media
